name: bold_public.08-nov-2024
title: BOLD DNA Barcode Reference Library 08-NOV-2024
description: BOLD Public Data Package containing TSV data and a metadata file compliant with Frictionless Standards, following BCDM

fields.name: processid
fields.title: process ID
fields.description: BOLD System generated unique identifier for the sample being sequenced.

fields.name: sampleid
fields.title: sample ID
fields.description: User generated identifier for the sample being sequenced, often identical to the Field ID or Museum ID.

fields.name: fieldid
fields.title: field ID
fields.description: Specimen or sample identifier generated in the field or lot number for a bulk collection event.

fields.name: museumid
fields.title: museum ID
fields.description: Catalog number from a museum collection.

fields.name: record_id
fields.title: record ID
fields.description: A BOLD generated identifier for the marker and specimen sequence combination.

fields.name: specimenid
fields.title: specimen ID
fields.description: BOLD System generated numerical ID associated with the specimen record.

fields.name: processid_minted_date
fields.title: processID minted date
fields.description: Date of record registration on BOLD.

fields.name: bin_uri
fields.title: BIN URI
fields.description: The Barcode Index Number (BIN) assigned to the COI sequence.

fields.name: bin_created_date
fields.title: BIN created date
fields.description: Date of BIN creation in BOLD.

fields.name: collection_code
fields.title: collection code
fields.description: Code associated with a given collection within an institution.

fields.name: inst
fields.title: institution
fields.description: Institution storing the physical specimen.

fields.name: sovereign_inst
fields.title: sovereign institution
fields.description: Institution with sovereignty over the physical specimen.

fields.name: taxid
fields.title: tax ID
fields.description: Identifier associated with the taxon assignment.

fields.name: kingdom
fields.title: kingdom
fields.description: Taxonomy: Kingdom.

fields.name: phylum
fields.title: phylum
fields.description: Taxonomy: Phylum.

fields.name: class
fields.title: class
fields.description: Taxonomy: Class.

fields.name: order
fields.title: order
fields.description: Taxonomy: Order.

fields.name: family
fields.title: family
fields.description: Taxonomy: Family.

fields.name: subfamily
fields.title: subfamily
fields.description: Taxonomy: Subfamily.

fields.name: tribe
fields.title: tribe
fields.description: Taxonomy: Tribe

fields.name: genus
fields.title: genus
fields.description: Taxonomy: Genus.

fields.name: species
fields.title: species
fields.description: Taxonomy: Species.

fields.name: subspecies
fields.title: subspecies
fields.description: Taxonomy: Subspecies.

fields.name: species_reference
fields.title: species reference
fields.description: Reference for species name/Authorship of the species name.

fields.name: identification
fields.title: identification
fields.description: Taxonomic identification of the specimen.

fields.name: identification_method
fields.title: identification method
fields.description: The method used to identify the specimen.

fields.name: identification_rank
fields.title: identification rank
fields.description: Taxonomic rank of the identification associated with the specimen.

fields.name: identified_by
fields.title: identified by
fields.description: Full name of primary individual responsible for providing the taxonomic identification of the specimen.

fields.name: identifier_email
fields.title: identifier email
fields.description: Identifier email address.

fields.name: taxonomy_notes
fields.title: taxonomy notes
fields.description: General notes regarding the taxonomy of the specimen.

fields.name: sex
fields.title: sex
fields.description: The sex of the specimen registered in the record. This field uses a controlled vocabulary: 'Male', 'female', 'hermaphrodite' only.

fields.name: reproduction
fields.title: reproduction
fields.description: Sexual/asexual/cyclic parthenogen only.

fields.name: life_stage
fields.title: life stage
fields.description: The age class or life stage of the specimen(s) at the time of sampling. Contolled vocabulary: 'Adult', 'Immature', 'Juvenile', 'Pupa'.

fields.name: short_note
fields.title: short note
fields.description: A brief note or term associated with the specimen to add context to the record.

fields.name: notes
fields.title: notes
fields.description: Detailed notes regarding the specimen.

fields.name: voucher_type
fields.title: voucher type
fields.description: Status of the specimen in an accessioning process.This field uses a controlled vocabulary: 'Museum Vouchered:Type', 'Museum Vouchered:Type Series', 'Vouchered:Registered Collection', 'To Be Vouchered:Holdup/Private', 'E-Vouchered:DNA/Tissue+Photo', 'Dna/Tissue Vouchered Only', 'No Specimen'.

fields.name: tissue_type
fields.title: tissue type
fields.description: A physical result of a sampling (or subsampling) event. In biological collections, the material sample is typically collected, and either preserved or destructively processed.

fields.name: specimen_linkout
fields.title: specimen linkout
fields.description: Link to an external resource for the specimen record.

fields.name: associated_specimens
fields.title: associated specimens
fields.description: A list (concatenated and comma separated) of other specimens associated with the subject specimen at the time of its collection. References to other specimen identifiers should be preceded by the relationship. Examples: 'host: PLANT23452, prey: USNM45677' when both prey and host specimens have been captured.

fields.name: associated_taxa
fields.title: associated taxa
fields.description: A list (concatenated and comma separated) of taxa associated with the specimen at the time of its collection. References to taxa should be preceded by the relationship. Use of this field implies knowledge of an associated specimen where the identification is an inference. Examples: [host: Quercus alba], [prey: caterpillar].

fields.name: collectors
fields.title: collectors
fields.description: Comma separated list of full or abbreviated names of the individuals or teams responsible for collecting the sample in the field.

fields.name: collection_date_start
fields.title: collection date start
fields.description: The start date for the associated collecting event.

fields.name: collection_date_end
fields.title: collection date end
fields.description: The end date for the associated collecting event.

fields.name: collection_event_id
fields.title: collection event ID
fields.description: An identifier for the set of information associated with an Event (something that occurs at a place and time). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

fields.name: collection_time
fields.title: collection time
fields.description: The time or time of day during which the sample was collected.

fields.name: collection_notes
fields.title: collection notes
fields.description: Comments or notes about the collection event.

fields.name: geoid
fields.title: geo ID
fields.description: Unique identifier assigned to the most detailed or specific geographic division available, either country/ocean or province/state.

fields.name: country/ocean
fields.title: country/ocean
fields.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the country, major political unit, or ocean.

fields.name: country_iso
fields.title: country ISO
fields.description: Country ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 code.

fields.name: province
fields.title: province/state
fields.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the state, province, territory, or prefecture within the given country.

fields.name: region
fields.title: region
fields.description: Park, county, district, lake or river.

fields.name: sector
fields.title: sector
fields.description: Sector of park or county/city.

fields.name: site
fields.title: site
fields.description: The name of the sampling location.

fields.name: site_code
fields.title: site code
fields.description: A short string representing the sampling location.

fields.name: coord
fields.title: GPS coordinate
fields.description: Latitude & Longitude in decimal degrees (DD) format (e.g. 45.837).

fields.name: coord_accuracy
fields.title: GPS coordinate accuracy
fields.description: Accuracy of coordinate in decimal degrees (DD).

fields.name: coord_source
fields.title: GPS coordinate source
fields.description: The source of the coordinates.

fields.name: elev
fields.title: elevation
fields.description: Elevation of sampling site. Measured in meters relative to sea level. Negative values indicate a position below sea level.

fields.name: elev_accuracy
fields.title: elevation accuracy
fields.description: Accuracy of the elevation value in meters.

fields.name: depth
fields.title: depth
fields.description: For organisms collected beneath the surface of a water body. Measured in meters below the surface of water.

fields.name: depth_accuracy
fields.title: depth accuracy
fields.description: The accuracy of the depth value in meters.

fields.name: habitat
fields.title: habitat
fields.description: A category or description of the habitat.

fields.name: realm
fields.title: realm
fields.description: A primary biogeographical division of Earth's surface, with eight distinct realms identified based on the RESOLVE ecoregion dataset (Dinerstein et al., 2017, BioScience 67).

fields.name: biome
fields.title: biome
fields.description: A distinct geographical region with specific climate, vegetation, and animal life, spanning multiple continents and encompassing several ecoregions. Based on the RESOLVE ecoregion dataset, there are 14 distinct biomes (Dinerstein et al., 2017, BioScience 67).

fields.name: ecoregion
fields.title: ecoregion
fields.description: Large land units with distinct natural communities and species, reflecting their original extent before major land-use changes. Nested within biomes and realms, there are 847 ecoregions based on the RESOLVE ecoregion dataset (Dinerstein et al., 2017, BioScience 67).

fields.name: sampling_protocol
fields.title: sampling protocol
fields.description: The names of, references to, or descriptions of the methods or protocols used to capture the associated specimen.

fields.name: nuc
fields.title: raw nucleotide sequence
fields.description: Nucleotide sequence as submitted.

fields.name: nuc_basecount
fields.title: nuc basecount
fields.description: Count of IUPAC non-degenerate nucleotide symbols.

fields.name: insdc_acs
fields.title: international nucleotide sequence database collaboration accession
fields.description: Accession number assigned to a sequence upon its deposition in one of the databases affiliated with the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration, 'www.insdc.org'.

fields.name: funding_src
fields.title: funding source
fields.description: Source of funding for data generation, curation, and publication.

fields.name: marker_code
fields.title: marker code
fields.description: Short code associated with the sequenced marker(gene).

fields.name: primers_forward
fields.title: primers forward
fields.description: A comma separated list of forward primer code and sequence pairs, with each code and sequence separated by a colon.

fields.name: primers_reverse
fields.title: primers reverse
fields.description: A comma separated list of reverse primer code and sequence pairs, with each code and sequence separated by a colon.

fields.name: sequence_run_site
fields.title: sequence run site
fields.description: Full name of the institution where sequencing was performed or the database the sequence was retrieved from.

fields.name: sequence_upload_date
fields.title: sequence upload date
fields.description: Date the sequence was uploaded.

fields.name: bold_recordset_code_arr
fields.title: recordsets
fields.description: A comma separated list of Projects and Datasets on BOLD that this record is associated with.
